title: (x) Snowdon serif face - Linotype Didot {Elliot M}
content:
Hello. This is probably an easy font for you to recognise.  
Just wanted to know whether anyone can tell what this font is?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908123054im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Snowdon_Text_5923.jpg)

D.

 [‹ (x) serif body type in 1966 book - Juliana {Christopher Purcell}](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908123054/http:/typophile.com/node/35278 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) RS & Sons script logo - (similar to) Jefferson (Freehand 575) {Mike Y} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908123054/http:/typophile.com/node/35300 "Go to next forum topic")
author: dwynn

comments.content:
It’s a Didot, probably Linotype Didot Bold looking at the round “O”

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/didot/linotype-didot-bold/](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908123054/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/didot/linotype-didot-bold/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/didot/linotype-didot-bold/")

I think Elliot has got it. The W and N from the Linotype Didot Bold match better than any other I could find. Most Bodoni W’s are crossed in the middle.

- Mike Yanega
